answers.answer: I had a spinal fusion at level L5 S1 on Dec 7th of this past year. It has been 6 weeks since surgery and I am having horrible right leg pain from knee down and foot and toe problems as well: tingling, burning: it is horrid: and for me it as at night time that it gets the worse too. My neuro did a Cat Scan last week and said he saw a "splinter" which is a piece of the bone fragment he had put in my back: he said he can go back in and do a simple surgical procedure to remove the "splinter" and that is what is causing the nerve problems I am experiencing. I am scared, I wonder is that really the reason for the problems I am having? I just wanted to write to tell you that I am going thru the same thing. It is horrible and it is so hard to endure problems after a surgery that was sopposed to help a problem....

question: Please advise me on the following difficult and unusually persistent problem:THE PROBLEM: I have severe pain on the bottom of both feet from my big toe, through the arch area, but never in the rear-heal area.  The pain does not affect any other part of my feet.  The pain began about two years ago.  It has progressively worsened to the point it is intolerable.  The pain is a burning, tingling sensation, and often a dull ache.  It is much worse at night.MEDICAL HISTORY:  Normal blood-sugar levels (i.e., I do not have diabetes).  I have Restless Leg Syndrome, and REQUIP (1mg/night) is 99% effective.  Ten years ago, I had two disks removed, and my spine was fused (L5-S1).PREVIOUS DIAGNOSES / TESTS / PAIN MEDICATION:  I’ve had three different diagnoses of my feet pain from various neurologists: (1) it has something to do with my RLS, (2) it is caused by nerve damage resulting from the rupture of my disks at L5-S1, (3) it is neuropathic pain.  Two nerve-conduction studies performed one year apart were both negative.  I occasionally take small amounts of MS Contin (15mg, about four or five times a month) for chronic back pain (Failed Back Surgery Syndrome).  It works well on my back pain, but is completely ineffective against the pain on the bottom of my feet.  I have not sought treatment from my spine surgeon because I am 3,000 miles away.QUESTIONS: Should I seek treatment from a spine expert to determine etiology of feet pain?  Should I request a Pain Management physician to assist me?  What else should I do?Thank you for your assistance.
title: Severe Feet Pain; Post Spinal Fusion
